title: ICPF launches $500 million capital raising
text:
Investa's unlisted wholesale office fund is the latest investment vehicle to take advantage of strong offshore demand for Australian property by seeking to raise $500 million in capital to finance development projects and new acquisitions and to replenish the fund's balance sheet.

Investa Commercial Property Fund, which owns several large-scale office towers in the two largest markets of Sydney and Melbourne, launched the capital raising on Tuesday, offering current investors – a mix of institutions and superannuation funds – pre-emptive rights to purchase new securities issued.

The tower at 135 King Street in Sydney.

It comes a month after redemptions were fully satisfied, with investors offered the opportunity in October 2018 to take money off the table. ICPF only opens a redemption window for investors every 10 years.

Peter Menegazzo, Investa’s chief investment officer, said the new capital would help fund recent acquisitions, including the recent 50 per cent stake in 135 King Street in Sydney's CBD, the nearby Glasshouse complex for $340 million and the strategic purchase of a carpark adjoining Investa's 567 Collins Street site in Melbourne.

The capital would also bring down the fund's level of gearing.
description: Investa's unlisted wholesale office fund is the latest investment vehicle to take advantage of strong offshore demand for Australian property
